channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Road to a Gaza Cease-Fire Runs Through Qatar
item.description: The emirate has used its influence with Hamas to press for a truce with Israel. But “the last word is with those on the battlefield,” one expert said.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Palestinians Assess Damage After Israeli Military Pulls Back From Jenin
item.description: Residents were taking stock of destruction from the 10-day Israeli raid, one of the deadliest in years in the occupied West Bank.

item.title: Telegram CEO Pavel Durov hits ‘misguided approach’ of French charges against him in first public comments
item.description: In a Telegram post late Thursday, Durov defended himself against the French judicial investigation, suggesting that he shouldn't have been targeted pe...

item.title: 100 Degrees at Midnight: California Coast Swelters in ‘Concerning’ Heat
item.description: Temperatures in the region were forecast to remain high into the weekend, with more than 31 million people under excessive heat warnings.

item.title: The Road to a Gaza Cease-Fire Runs Through Qatar
item.description: The emirate has used its influence with Hamas to press for a truce with Israel. But “the last word is with those on the battlefield,” one expert said.

item.title: As singles ditch dating apps, the Spanish are finding love in supermarket aisles—with some help from pineapples
item.description: Dating apps are getting boring and tedious. The Spanish are turning instead to supermarkets in the hopes of finding romance.

item.title: Father of Georgia Shooting Suspect Charged, and a Pivotal Jobs Report
item.description: Plus, the Taliban codifies dire restrictions on women.

item.title: Fire at School Dormitory in Kenya Kills at Least 17 Students
item.description: President William Ruto called the news “devastating.” The blaze has brought renewed attention to concerns about the safety of Kenyan schools.

item.title: Harris campaign raised $361 million in August—more than double Trump haul
item.description: The massive Harris war chest is being used to fund a $370 million paid media effort for the final two months of the campaign.

item.title: U.S. Blowback to Nippon Steel-U.S. Steel Merger Vexes Japan
item.description: A looming decision in Washington to block Nippon Steel’s merger with U.S. Steel on national security grounds is raising sharp questions in Tokyo.

item.title: Against This Mighty Paralympic Team, a Close Loss Can Feel Like a Win
item.description: Other teams give themselves an A for effort after playing the Dutch women’s wheelchair basketball team, the favorite for the gold medal at the Paris G...

item.title: Treasury says IRS push has recovered $1.3 billion in unpaid taxes from wealthy since late 2023
item.description: Between 2010 and 2018, the audit rate for millionaires fell by 80%, according to Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen.

item.title: Harris Opens $110 Million Cash Edge Over Trump After August Fund-Raising Haul
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris’s campaign reported raising $361 million in August, her first full month as the Democrats’ nominee, far surpassing the $1...

item.title: Distracted and Divided, Russian Security Service Misses Threats
item.description: The Ukrainian offensive over the border caught Moscow’s intelligence agencies by surprise, experts say. It wasn’t the first time that has happened dur...

item.title: Real estate developer convicted alongside New Jersey Sen. Bob Menendez pleads guilty to bank fraud
item.description: Fred Daibes, 67, entered the plea in U.S. District Court in Newark, the U.S. Attorney's office said in a statement.
